name: Attachment
description: Represents a file that a user can attach to a parent object record.
summary:
The `Attachment` object in Salesforce has the following attributes:

1. **Id**: A unique identifier for the attachment (type: `id`).
2. **IsDeleted**: Indicates whether the attachment has been deleted (type: `boolean`).
3. **ParentId**: The ID of the parent record to which the attachment is associated (type: `reference`).
4. **Name**: The name of the attachment (type: `string`).
5. **IsPrivate**: Indicates whether the attachment is private (type: `boolean`).
6. **ContentType**: The MIME type of the attachment (type: `string`).
7. **BodyLength**: The size of the attachment in bytes (type: `int`).
8. **Body**: The actual content of the attachment, encoded in base64 (type: `base64`).
9. **OwnerId**: The ID of the user who owns the attachment (type: `reference`).
10. **CreatedDate**: The date and time when the attachment was created (type: `datetime`).
11. **CreatedById**: The ID of the user who created the attachment (type: `reference`).
12. **LastModifiedDate**: The date and time when the attachment was last modified (type: `datetime`).
13. **LastModifiedById**: The ID of the user who last modified the attachment (type: `reference`).
14. **SystemModstamp**: The date and time when the attachment record was last modified by the system (type: `datetime`).
15. **Description**: A description of the attachment (type: `textarea`).

These attributes allow for the management and tracking of files attached to records within Salesforce.
label: Attachment
